answers.text: One of the foundation's goals is to lower poverty by increasing the number of college graduates in the United States

qas.question: One way to increase college graduation by the foundation is

answers.text: One of the ways the foundation has sought to increase the number of college graduates is to get them through college faster

qas.question: how did they work on college financing

answers.text: Reimagining Aid Design and Delivery" grants to think tanks and advocacy organizations

qas.question: What has the United States tried to do to increase the number of college graduates?

plausible_answers.text: increasing the number of college graduates

qas.question: What is the goal of think tanks to lower poverty in the United States?
What groups will produce grants for changing the financial aid system?

plausible_answers.text: Reimagining Aid Design and Delivery" grants

qas.question: What did the foundation fund to change the poverty rate?
What does the foundation want to lower by changing financial aid?

context: <a0_0>One of the foundation's goals is to lower <b7_0>poverty<b7_0/> by <b4_0>increasing the number of college graduates<b4_0/> in the United States<a0_0/>, and the organization has funded "<a2_0><b6_0>Reimagining Aid Design and Delivery" grants<b6_0/> to <b5_0>think tanks and advocacy organizations<b5_0/><a2_0/> to produce white papers on ideas for changing the current system of federal financial aid for college students, with a goal of increasing graduation rates. <a1_0>One of the ways the foundation has sought to increase the number of college graduates is to <b3_0>get them through college faster<b3_0/><a1_0/>, but that idea has received some pushback from organizations of universities and colleges.
